description.en: International judicial system has significantly gained momentum in recent decades. States are more frequently settling their disputes before international courts and have increasingly accepted their jurisdiction in advance. At the same time, there are new courts and tribunals where natural or legal persons can appear either as plaintiffs or defendants. The course examines international courts and tribunals from historical, political and legal perspectives. The focus is foremost on inter-State dispute settlement, but the course looks also at investment disputes and criminal prosecution. The course explains first the general legal framework for peaceful settlement of disputes and then turns to selected international courts and tribunals to examine the reasons for having such institutions and the specifics of their creation and functioning. Discussion cover such issues as jurisdiction, admissibility, provisional measures, applicable law, procedure, decision-making process, enforcement of decisions etc.
description.et: Rahvusvahelise õigusmõistmise süsteemi tähtsus on oluliselt tõusnud viimastel aastakümnetel. Riigid pöörduvad üha tihedamini omavaheliste vaidluste lahendamiseks rahvusvaheliste kohtute poole ja aktsepteerivad üha rohkem etteulatuvalt nende jurisdiktsiooni. Samas on juurde tulnud ka kohtuid ja tribunale, kus menetluse osapoolteks saavad olla ka füüsilised ja juriidilised isikud, kas hageja, kostja või süüdistatuna. Õppeaine uurib rahvusvahelisi kohtuid ja tribunale ajaloolisest, poliitilisest ja õiguslikust vaatenurgast. Fookus on ennekõike riikidevaheliste vaidluste lahendamisel, kuid õppeaine käsitleb ka investeerimisvaidlusi ja kriminaalmenetlust. Alustuseks selgitatakse vaidluste rahumeelse lahendamise õiguslikku raamistikku. Seejärel võetakse vaatluse alla valitud rahvusvahelised kohtud ja tribunalid, et selgitada nende olemasolu põhjuseid ning uurida loomise ja toimimise detaile. Käsitlemist leiavad sellised teemad nagu jurisdiktsioon, vastuvõetavas, ajutised meetmed, kohalduv õigus, menetlus, otsuse vastuvõtmise protsess, lahendite täideviimine jms.

objectives.en: To provide an overview of the foundations of international judicial system as well as of the role, powers, functioning and outcomes (successes and failures) of major international courts and tribunals

independent_work.et:
*	Independent work with study materials
*	Moot court: (i)	Preparing a written memorial and (ii) preparing and participating in an oral presentation.

Students take part in simulated court proceedings, which involves drafting memorials and participating in oral argument. The Moot Court follows a simplified ICJ procedure. Teams of students are given a role (applicant, respondent or a country intervening) in the proceedings. Students have to file an electronic memorandum on behalf of their client via e-mail. The precise time schedule will be announced at the beginning of the course. The requirements regarding written work are given during the course. The students have to represent their client before the moot court in the oral proceedings.

grade_preconditions.et: *	Participation in seminars. Absence is only allowed for good reason and with notice to the instructor.

grade_evaluation.et: The moot court exercise gives up to 10% of the final grade. The written exam at the end of the course gives up to 90% of the final grade. The written exam lasts for 90 minutes and comprises multiple-choice questions, short-answer questions and a question requiring longer analysis.
